image.altText: Donald Trump raises a fist while speaking on stage.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has taken the stage at the Republican National Convention for his first public speech since an attempt on his life. Meanwhile, US media is reporting "reality is setting in" for a "soul-searching" US President Joe Biden as pressure mounts to quit the presidential race. Follow live.

title.children: 'I'm not supposed to be here': Trump reflects on shooting as he accepts Republican nomination

image.altText: Joe Biden, wearing a cap, slacks and a jumper, waves as he descends the stairs of an airplane

props.synopsis: The US president, currently isolating with COVID-19, is said to be reflecting on whether to drop out as the presumptive Democratic candidate in the November election.

title.children: Biden reportedly 'soul-searching' on whether to stay in 2024 presidential race

image.altText: The buildings of the Ashley Youth Detention Centre sit behind a tall fence.

props.synopsis: A detainee at Tasmania's only youth detention centre wrote to the premier last year, claiming the young detainees feel like "dogs at the dogs' home" and are not being given a chance to turn their lives around.

title.children: Child's letter from notorious prison says 'even cows in the paddocks next to Ashley have more freedom than us'

image.altText: Risdon Prison, Tasmania

props.synopsis: A doctor who recommended a Tasmanian inmate spend more time in hospital for their own safety was banned from entering the prison the following day for "security" reasons, a report has found.

title.children: Doctor who defied Tasmanian prison over inmate's health banned from prison the next day, report finds

image.altText: Two small snowmen made from sleet on a car park ground in Guyra New Suoth Wales

props.synopsis: Parts of eastern Australia are set for another round of fierce wintry weather, with warnings of damaging winds for several states, and blizzards in Australia's alpine regions from Friday.

title.children: Damaging winds, snow and rain forecast for eastern Australia

image.altText: A woman holds a toddler next to a man and a dog in between a row of trees

props.synopsis: Ditching corporate lives in busy cities, these tree changers are moving to rural Tasmania in search of a different life.

title.children: 'Nothing better in the world': City dwellers ditch the rat race and find fulfilment in the Tasmanian countryside

image.altText: a man wearing glasses standing outdoors in front of a media pack

props.synopsis: The former NSW Liberal leader, who was the state's premier from October 2021 to March 2023, announces his resignation from politics and will head up BHP's office in Washignton DC.

title.children: Perrottet lands plum job in US after announcing end of his political career

image.altText: A man wearing an Uncle Sam style striped red hat and a bandage on his ear labelled FIGHT FIGHT FIGHT

props.synopsis: Following the assassination attempt on Donald Trump, political leaders on both sides called for the election campaign to tone down the divisive rhetoric. But inside the Republican National Convention, there are plenty of doubts about America's ability to turn down the heat.

title.children: Inside Milwaukee's MAGA convention, Republicans are angry — and confident a big change is coming

image.altText: A man in a fawn-coloured coat smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: The search history of Tasmanian Supreme Court judge Gregory Geason shows he visited webpage 'Phone tracker: Type in a phone number and find a location' while under a restraining order after the alleged assault of a woman.

title.children: Judge visits 'how to get domestic violence charges dropped — step-by-step' webpage after alleged assault, court hears

image.altText: Two police officers are in uniform with their faces blurred out. In the background are houses and empty land

props.synopsis: Police are ordered to reinvestigate allegations they used unreasonable force against kids during a shopping centre scuffle.

title.children: Watch this police officer's response when he's asked, 'How many Black kids are you going to assault?'

image.altText: A large outside view of a compound

props.synopsis: The number of refugees being held on Nauru has increased sixfold in six months, even though the centre was empty at one stage last year.

title.children: Offshore detention numbers increase sixfold as advocates slam policy as 'financial and moral vacuum'

image.altText: A closeup shot of the prime minister looking sombre, wearing glasses and frowning

props.synopsis: No doubt the administrators will clean out the CFMEU. But you'd be an optimist to feel confident that one collection of bad applies won't eventually be replaced by another.

title.children: The bad apples at the CFMEU are on the way out. The next crop deserves close attention

image.altText: A close up shows a red cap with white text in all caps saying TRUMP FOREVER

props.synopsis: Trump's speech, and the entire atmosphere of the Republican National Convention, are reminders of America's new direction. They're also a chance to recall his record in office and judge it against what he's offering now.

title.children: Trump is not a blip, he's the correction. The Republican party on show this week is the new normal

image.altText: A composite of two ads on Facebook Marketplace.

props.synopsis: The Demerit Point Integrity Taskforce has been set up to investigate drivers manipulating the demerit point system by nominating another driver to take demerit points for an offence.

title.children: Crackdown on drivers selling demerit points online after French man had 200 applied to licence

image.altText: Hacking

props.synopsis: eScripts provider MediSecure has revealed 12.9 million Australians had personal data stolen in a cyber breach earlier this year, making it one of the largest data hacks in Australian history.

title.children: MediSecure 'not in a financial position' to identify 12.9m Australians who had data stolen

image.altText: A green bus driving on a road.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's biggest private bus companies turns down government funding that would have gone directly to driver wage increases, leaked documents show.

title.children: Bus company refuses government-funded wage rises for its own drivers

image.altText: A colourful illustrations shows the neon paths of computer circuits arranged to resemble an illuminated human brain.

props.synopsis: Experts say AI is the "largest gold rush in the history of capitalism", and that Australia is falling behind. But there's something else we're also trailing the pack on: the time it takes to manage privacy settings on websites.

title.children: Is Australia snoozing through the 'largest gold rush in the history of capitalism'?

image.altText: A close up of Greg Lynn standing in front of a body of water near some rocks.

props.synopsis: Former Jetstar pilot Greg Lynn will appeal his murder conviction, his lawyer says, after he was found guilty of killing retiree Carol Clay in Victoria's High Country.

title.children: Media reports about Greg Lynn have 'poisoned the well of justice', lawyer tells court

image.altText: A pencil and watercolour sketch of a historic two-storey building with shops on the street level

props.synopsis: Comic artist Jo Waite has spent her adult life renting and squatting in Melbourne's inner suburbs, watching gentrification unfold in real time. Now, she is drawing her old homes one by one — but the beauty of the grand homes hides the reality of life inside them for tenants in decades past.

title.children: 'The call of a million dollars': How gentrification changed the neighbourhoods that were once affordable to artists

image.altText: Two drawers full of hundreds of loose bird eggs.

props.synopsis: Federal environmental officers say the Hobart man is alleged to have traded with someone in Europe and amassed a collection of more than 3,000 eggs, including many native Australian birds.

title.children: Officers swoop on man with more than 3,000 bird eggs, including from one of Australia's rarest birds

image.altText: Luke Ryan reacts after Fremantle's loss to Hawthorn

props.synopsis: The AFL is investigating exactly what took place after Fremantle players were forced to fly home from a Launceston match with no working toilets due to a plane running out of water half an hour into a four-hour journey.

title.children: 'Utterly unacceptable': Dockers left with no working toilets on flight after Launceston match

image.altText: Georgia Weir, in black hoodie with long brown hair tied up, smiles. Body of water and green hills are behind her.

props.synopsis: For Kuku Yalanji woman Georgia Weir, running became a way to manage the impacts of trauma that she'd battled for much of her life. Now she's keen to share its incredible impact with as many people as she can.

title.children: This young mum was in crisis. She says one routine 'completely changed the trajectory of my life'

image.altText: Scientists open an octopus.

props.synopsis: School-age, university students and keen members of the public have gathered to observe a rare public dissection of a 140kg octopus squid found off South Australia's Eyre Peninsula.

title.children: 'Exceptionally rare' octopus squid dissected by researchers at SA university

image.altText: Composite imape of the Shogun, Donald Trump shielded by a woman and Novak Djokovic looking sad.

props.synopsis: It's time to test your knowledge about the news of the week.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Emmy's big nod to Shōgun, Trump's lifesaver and a Djokovic loss

image.altText: A blonde white woman wearing a pink suit raises her hands in celebration and smiles

props.synopsis: The German former defence minister outlined the climate crisis and European Union defence cooperation as the focus for her five-year term.

title.children: Von der Leyen pledges strong defence union and green transition in new EU term

image.altText: Three researchers hold small fish in water and give a thumbs up to the camera above them.

props.synopsis: Researchers say there is evidence that previously unknown breeding "nurseries" for critically endangered green sawfish could disappear due to continuing habitat loss in northern Western Australia.

title.children: Green sawfish are already under threat but development in WA's north could make matters worse

image.altText: Generic photo of a Westpac branch

props.synopsis: The banking regulator has lowered Westpac's risk capital requirements, while the S&P/ASX200 dipped back below 8000pts in Friday's trade to finish the day lower.

title.children: As it happened: APRA trims Westpac's risk capital, ASX200 trades lower

image.altText: Dave holding a brush, standing in front of the large cowboy he painted.

props.synopsis: The craft of sign painting has taken a hit in the digital era but painters like Dave Johnson say computers cannot replicate the charm of hand-produced pieces.

title.children: Old-school sign painter battles against computers to keep lost art alive

image.altText: A man standing near sunflowers out the front of his suburban home.

props.synopsis: Home ownership is a cornerstone of the Australian dream — but for many it feels increasingly out of reach.

title.children: Donggang's home has doubled in value since he bought — but he's not happy about it

image.altText: Bob Newhart wears a green elf suit and glasses

props.synopsis: Bob Newhart, a stand-up comedian who became one of the most popular TV stars of his time, has died at 94.

title.children: Comedian Bob Newhart, star of Elf and The Big Bang Theory, dies at 94

image.altText: ATO Melbourne office, logo on the wall.

props.synopsis: The message is clear: the honeymoon period is now over for businesses that were extended during the COVID-19 pandemic, as the ATO works to recoup more than $50 billion in debt.

title.children: How the ATO went from good cop to bad cop to claw back more than $50 billion in debt

image.altText: Two Wests Tigers NRL players looking downward and dejected after a loss

props.synopsis: Former NRL player Josh Mansour has joined a growing chorus of experts questioning the trajectory of the club and, specifically, a move Shane Richardson made during the club's bye in Round 13.

title.children: 'It's really derailed the Wests Tigers': Issues laid bare as battlers try to avoid third-straight wooden spoon

image.altText: Nuclear and Canada picture

props.synopsis: Canadian experts say it's not too late for Australia to build a nuclear power industry. But should we?

title.children: What Australia can learn from Canada's nuclear power industry

image.altText: A fox terrier-poodle cross wears a jacket while standing next to a river, looking at the water.

props.synopsis: When it comes to staying warm in winter, many of you are making sure your dogs are rugged up. But not all pets enjoy the extra layer. Here are your photos and experiences.

title.children: All the ways your dogs love (and hate) wearing jackets
